title: Rossendale Way Walk Route

images.title: robert wade / The Rossendale Way
images.caption: The Rossendale Way. Passing Calf Hey Reservoir which was built between 1854 and 1859 by the Bury and Radcliffe Waterworks.

images.title: michael ely / Rossendale Way
images.caption: The footpath heads under the pylons south-westwards towards Meadow Head. Shot taken from the crossroads of bridleway and footpath at SD838276.

images.title: Kevin Rushton / The Rossendale Way
images.caption: This cross was restored by Alderman Samuel Compston in 1902. It's located just south of Burnley near Clowbridge Reservoir. One reason for crosses such as this was to help guide travellers across the moors.

images.title: michael ely / Hades Hill, Rossendale Way
images.caption: Hades Hill. The gate is at the junction with a bridleway leading down the valley towards Walsden and the Rossendale Way close to the summit of Hades Hill. The nondescript summit affords a great 360 degree panorama of these wild moors.

images.title: robert wade / Stile on The Rossendale Way
images.caption: Stile on the trail, just east of Blackburn

images.title: liz dawson / Calf hey Reservoir from Rossendale Way
images.caption: Calf hey Reservoir from Rossendale Way

description: This circular walk takes you on a tour of the lovely Rossendale area of Lancashire and Greater Manchester. The path passes Haslingden , Rawtenstall , Whitworth, Stubbins and Healey with a series of attractive reservoirs including Cowpe and Calf Hey real highlights. Near Calf Hey you'll cross Holcombe Moor where you'll pass Musbury Tor and the Peel Tower . The distinctive monument is dedicated to Sir Robert Peel, the 19th century Prime Minister considered the father of modern British policing. It's a major local landmark and worth the climb to the top for the views over the area. The walk also takes you through the delightful Healey Dell Nature Reserve with waterfalls and wildlife to enjoy here. The views of the South Pennine hills are also splendid and make a fine backdrop to the walk.
